articles.headline: Trump Administration Sharply Curtails Fetal Tissue Medical Research
articles.snippet: The Trump administration will be ending a major university contract involving fetal tissue research and will soon stop such work at the National Institutes of Health.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration will be ending a major university contract involving fetal tissue research and will soon stop such work at the National Institutes of Health.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration announced Wednesday that the federal government would sharply curtail federal spending on medical research that uses tissue from aborted fetuses, mainly by ending fetal-tissue research within the National Institutes of Health.

articles.headline: Their Fathers Never Spoke of the War. Their Children Want to Know Why.
articles.snippet: Seventy-five years after D-Day, families of World War II veterans are turning to professional researchers to piece their stories together from military records.
articles.abstract: Seventy-five years after D-Day, families of World War II veterans are turning to professional researchers to piece their stories together from military records.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — All his life, Joseph Griesser hungered to hear the story of his father’s Army service in World War II.

articles.headline: Putin Aims to Revive the Economy With a Plan. And Pianos.
articles.snippet: As Russian officials unveil a spending plan aimed at doubling growth in its troubled economy, critics see a $400 billion effort in Soviet-era planning.
articles.abstract: As Russian officials unveil a spending plan aimed at doubling growth in its troubled economy, critics see a $400 billion effort in Soviet-era planning.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Even as Russia has muscled back onto the world stage politically, its economy suffers from flat growth and shrinking incomes.
articles.byline: By Ivan Nechepurenko and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: How China Tariffs Could Make Your Sweaters and Pants Cost More
articles.snippet: An array of added expenses may be passed on to consumers once the new trade policies are enacted.
articles.abstract: An array of added expenses may be passed on to consumers once the new trade policies are enacted.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration’s threat to impose new tariffs on nearly everything that comes to the United States from China has sent American retailers scrambling. Many rely on China for some portion of their manufacturing, and the new tariffs — as much as 25 percent on the roughly $300 billion worth of goods that so far have been untouched by the trade war — could force the companies to change where and how they make their products.

articles.headline: Tech Giants Amass a Lobbying Army for an Epic Washington Battle
articles.snippet: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google, facing the growing possibility of antitrust action and legislation to rein in their power, are spending freely to gain influence and access.
articles.abstract: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google, facing the growing possibility of antitrust action and legislation to rein in their power, are spending freely to gain influence and access.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Faced with the growing possibility of antitrust actions and legislation to curb their power, four of the biggest technology companies are amassing an army of lobbyists as they prepare for what could be an epic fight over their futures.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: In China, a Viral Video Sets Off a Challenge to Rape Culture
articles.snippet: The images were meant to exonerate Richard Liu, the e-commerce mogul. They have also helped fuel a nascent #NoPerfectVictim movement.
articles.abstract: The images were meant to exonerate Richard Liu, the e-commerce mogul. They have also helped fuel a nascent #NoPerfectVictim movement.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard Liu, the Chinese e-commerce billionaire, walked into an apartment building around 10 p.m., a young woman on his arm and his assistant in tow. Leaving the assistant behind, the young woman took Mr. Liu to an elevator. Then, she showed him into her apartment.

articles.headline: Fiat Chrysler Withdraws Its Offer for Renault
articles.snippet: The plan had faced resistance by some Renault shareholders who argued that the Italian-American conglomerate was undervaluing a crown jewel of French industry.
articles.abstract: The plan had faced resistance by some Renault shareholders who argued that the Italian-American conglomerate was undervaluing a crown jewel of French industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Fiat Chrysler late Wednesday abruptly withdrew its proposal to merge with Renault, walking away from a deal that could have fundamentally reshaped the global auto industry.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Election Rules Are an Obstacle to Cybersecurity of Presidential Campaigns
articles.snippet: Security experts warn that time is running out for campaigns to create protections against the cyberattacks and disinformation seen in recent elections.
articles.abstract: Security experts warn that time is running out for campaigns to create protections against the cyberattacks and disinformation seen in recent elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: One year out from the 2020 elections, presidential candidates face legal roadblocks to acquiring the tools and assistance necessary to defend against the cyberattacks and disinformation campaigns that plagued the 2016 presidential campaign.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: The Car Industry Is Under Siege
articles.snippet: Fiat Chrysler and Renault’s attempt to join forces was a response to turmoil in the auto industry, which accounts for much of the world’s factory jobs.
articles.abstract: Fiat Chrysler and Renault’s attempt to join forces was a response to turmoil in the auto industry, which accounts for much of the world’s factory jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — It’s a scary time to be in the car business.
